channel.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
channel.description:
I don't know what forum or thread this should be in or even if it's ever posted but BAH. IT'S -IMPORTANT. Fuck it if it's supposed to be in the news section!
[url=http://www.petitiononline.com/stopacta/petition.html]Petition's here.[/url]
The fuck is this. Google this shit, learn all you can. This is some seriously bad shit. If this passes it will definitely be no bueno. There is no way this is a good thing.
Copy pasted from Id-Boomer's journal here: [url=http://id-boomer.deviantart.com/journal/33468945/]http://id-boomer.deviantart.com/journal/33468945/[/url]
------------------
[i]So like some ACTA shit is going to stop piracy, WHICH ISN'T A BAD DEAL BUT HERES THE CATCH.
THIS IS NOT ABOUT PIRACY. THIS IS ABOUT PRIVACY.
Everyone on a computer will be monitored of their progress. No more privacy at all for anybody. NOPE.
- ISPS will now watch what you download, and tattle on you if you download a music track/ any data / rapidshares / torrents etc. - ISPS will tattle on you, when you do anything which goes against "Governments policy". - ISPS will be able to document and store EVERYTHING you do online. nothing will ever be private again
Potential border searches are covered by the "Border Measures" proposal of ACTA. As of February 2009 and according to University of Ottawa law professor Michael Geist there is significant disagreement among countries on this topic: "Some countries are seeking the minimum rules, the removal of certain clauses, and a specific provision to put to rest fears of iPod searching customs officials by excluding personal baggage that contains goods of a non-commercial nature. The U.S. is pushing for broad provisions that cover import, export, and in-transit shipments."[42] Newspaper reported that the draft agreement would empower security officials at airports and other international borders to conduct random ex officio searches of laptops, MP3 players, and cellular phones for illegally downloaded or "ripped" music and movies. Travellers with infringing content would be subject to a fine and may have their devices confiscated or destroyed.[/i]
New link has been added with the following information:
"Canadian officials travel to Guadalajara, Mexico this week to resume negotiations on the still-secret Anti-Counterfeiting Trade Agreement. The discussion is likely to turn to the prospect of supporting three strikes and you’re out systems that could result in thousands of people losing access to the Internet based on three allegations of copyright infringement. Leaked ACTA documents indicate that encouraging the adoption of three-strikes - often euphemistically described as “graduated response” for the way Internet providers gradually send increasingly threatening warnings to subscribers - has been proposed for possible inclusion in the treaty."
Fucking niggers. I know you guys don't want that, right MITB? I know nobody is going to want this shit. This shit is serious.
They're going to monitor EVERYONE AND THEIR PRIVACY WILL BE GONE. And I don't want to log into my computer and see that someone is watching me.
Information acquired here, read the whole thing! [url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.stopacta.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=4]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.stopacta.org/viewtopic.php?f=9&t=4[/url]
---
Extra Links you should pay close attention to;
[url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=acLW1vFO-2Q]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=acLW1vFO-2Q[/url]
This is basically what's controlling everything in the current world. Global corporations, and politics. They don't want you to be smart. They don't want you to think you can make a difference. Prove them wrong.
[url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://pastebin.com/ytZ7N1x7]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://pastebin.com/ytZ7N1x7[/url] [url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.stopacta.org/index.php]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.stopacta.org/index.php[/url]
[url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.dailytech.com/EUs+Secret+Plan+to+Imprison+Filesharers+Ban+Free+Speech+About+Piracy+Leaks/article18934.htm]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.dailytech.com/EUs+Secret+Plan+to+Imprison+Filesharers+Ban+Free+Speech+About+Piracy+Leaks/article18934.htm[/url] [url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.osnews.com/story/23002/Obama_Sides_with_RIAA_MPAA_Backs_ACTA]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.osnews.com/story/23002/Obama_Sides_with_RIAA_MPAA_Backs_ACTA[/url]
[url=http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.thestar.com/business/article/755443--geist-three-strikes-and-you-re-out-system-draw-cries-of-foul-from-governments]http://www.deviantart.com/users/outgoing?http://www.thestar.com/business/article/755443--geist-three-strikes-and-you-re-out-system-draw-cries-of-foul-from-governments[/url]
Tell as many people as you can. This needs as much attention as it can get! This is a SERIOUS CRISIS. They need to know we are here, and they need to know that we won't stand for it! People who are completely innocent can be subject to this. Even if you haven't downloaded a SINGLE file illegally EVER, they WILL target you. No one is safe.
And I'm not stopping until people start joining in, this minimum amount is ridiculous.
Sign the petition! This isn't even about piracy anymore, it's about privacy!
[url=http://www.petitiononline.com/stopacta/petition.html]http://www.petitiononline.com/stopacta/petition.html[/url]
For fucks sake do it. I want this shit to end.

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:50, topic:348646”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=445026.msg3269605#msg3269605 date=1279102817]
i just felt the urge to express that piracy is stupid and no matter what people say, it cannot be justified)
[/quote]

There is absolutely no justification at all for pirating any sort of media.

I agree with both of you in all but one case. Pirating software or other types of media (songs, books, movies) I believe is justified in countries where that particular item is banned, such as Australia banning any number of games, and middle eastern countries banning all sorts of songs, books, and movies. I think it is justified there because they couldn’t legally buy them if they wanted to, and it should be their right to choose whether or not they want to use them, not the oppressive government’s.

Other than that, we are on the same page. :)[/quote]I’ll have to think about that one a bit

Read full topic
item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Speljohan:

i just felt the urge to express that piracy is stupid and no matter what people say, it cannot be justified)

Thug-life:

There is absolutely no justification at all for pirating any sort of media.

I agree with both of you in all but one case. Pirating software or other types of media (songs, books, movies) I believe is justified in countries where that particular item is banned, such as Australia banning any number of games, and middle eastern countries banning all sorts of songs, books, and movies. I think it is justified there because they couldn’t legally buy them if they wanted to, and it should be their right to choose whether or not they want to use them, not the oppressive government’s.

Other than that, we are on the same page.

Read full topic
item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

People can say they wouldn’t buy the product they are illegally downloading, but that doesn’t change the vast amount of people who do nothing BUT download music illegally, who have not paid for music in years.

That argument is a good one to pull, but really, it doesn’t matter if it is for personal use and wasn’t going to buy it anyway. It matters that you are obtaining a product that you do not legally have any right to use. It does not matter at all the outcome or effects of you doing that, the one and only important fact remains - you do not have any right to take that product without paying for it.

These industries want to stop piracy for the knock on effect, letting slide will just lead to continued loss of custom. I know so many people who laugh at other people who not stealing their games or music, it is now a culture problem - people see no implications on their actions or encouragement of others., it goes beyond people taking it because they wouldn’t buy it anyway, it goes to people who would usually be a customer to someone who finds it easier just to pirate everything.

There is absolutely no justification at all for pirating any sort of media.

Read full topic
item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:47, topic:348646”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=445026.msg3269668#msg3269668 date=1279109187]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=445026.msg3269661#msg3269661 date=1279108452]

People who partake in illegal downloading of copyrighted goods don’t want to or care to justify their actions. They just want to be left in piece so that they can use the stuff they acquire for personal use.
[/quote]People who rob banks don’t want to or care to justify their actions. They just want to be left in peace so that they can use the money they aquired for personal use.

Fair argument, except at the end of the day the computer files are reproducible and the bank money isn’t.
[/quote]Except it is in many countries (including USA), because the economy doesn’t have a base, and is created out of thin air.[/quote]
You’re not serious are you? It’s completely different.

Read full topic

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:41, topic:348646”][quote author=Mopman link=topic=445026.msg3268564#msg3268564 date=1279049883]
I agree - but apparently you missed the part where it was an anti piracy bill. That’s not to say it should automatically happen, but its not like talking about piracy when talking about an anti-piracy bill is a bad idea.
[/quote]
I know it’s an anti piracy bill, I was basically try to steer people away from comments like this:

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=445026.msg3268577#msg3268577 date=1279050661]

I agree - but apparently you missed the part where it was an anti piracy bill. That’s not to say it should automatically happen, but its not like talking about piracy when talking about an anti-piracy bill is a bad idea.
[/quote]Also, like i previously said: Whenever someone mentions something that is anti-piracy, the idealists shout “BREACHING MY PRIVACY”, because it’s the only excuse they have.

Because there are violations of privacy in the ACTA bill and just because it is anti-piracy it doesn’t mean the concessions against privacy are acceptable.[/quote]I wasn’t really referring to this law though, i was speaking in general (i haven’t really looked at this yet, i just felt the urge to express that piracy is stupid and no matter what people say, it cannot be justified)

Read full topic

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

PRIVACY and PIRACY are two different issues, you are just asking for problems discussing them in the same thread.

PRIVACY is needed for thousands of other reasons completely unrelated to PIRACY. Such as evading illegal filters governments place on legitimate internet content, and avoiding illegal sniffing, whether it is being done by the government, a neighbor, or an ISP. There are many other reasons as well, all legitimate and needed. We can’t have someone who wants PRIVACY labeled as a PIRATE, it’s just wrong.

Read full topic
item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

If you stole an ipod, the store would make a loss because they would have already paid for it. It doesn’t cost the music industry anything when someone pirates their music, it just reduces the overall sales slightly because some people have stopped paying for music:

i agree, and didn’t mean to imply that “piracy” and stealing are the same thing, but that both are wrong

item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:31, topic:348646”]loss estimations for stores are also grossly overestimated, im not wealthy at all and cannot condone the pricetag on anything, thus i just take what the fuck i want? me stealing an ipod and some bread isnt going to kill the retail industry!

edit: nevermind the fact you have plenty of options that arent buying cds[/quote]
If you stole an ipod, the store would make a loss because they would have already paid for it. It doesn’t cost the music industry anything when someone pirates their music, it just reduces the overall sales slightly because some people have stopped paying for music:

the bank:

I’m sure many of us (myself included) have downloaded simply because we see something cool…but in no way would we ever consider actually buying it.

If anything, the music industry is probably doing better than ever - what with internet advertising (myspace, last.fm etc), and legal sources of music like iTunes. Free access to music has encouraged more people to be more interested in it, and to potentially buy legal music online or from a store. Before I found out how to download music for free I didn’t have a single CD, and I’m sure this is the case for other people too.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

loss estimations for stores are also grossly overestimated, im not wealthy at all and cannot condone the pricetag on anything, thus i just take what the fuck i want? me stealing an ipod and some bread isnt going to kill the retail industry!

edit: nevermind the fact you have plenty of options that arent buying cds

item.source: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

the bank:

Piracy laws have always seemed stupid to me because they always figure that if you didn’t steal it then you would have bought it. Nothing could be further from the truth as we all know…I’m sure many of us (myself included) have downloaded simply because we see something cool…but in no way would we ever consider actually buying it.

This is actually an important point. Loss estimations are oftentimes (if not always) grossly overestimated.
And seriously, people thought cassette tape recordings were going to kill the radio and VHS was going to be the end of television.

As a person that isn’t poor but isn’t particularly wealthy either, I simply cannot condone a $20+ price tag for a music CD. As a deterrent to the music industry I will happily encourage others to exercise their right to fair use.

Read full topic

item.title: Destroy the ACTA! Save the fucking internet!
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

who the hell cares about piracy? i hear adverts saying “piracy is killing the music industry bla bla” would an artist turn down a career knowing they only get say, half the money they could be getting? 5 mil instead of 10? GTFO. artists wanna make money, and they will do.

I can safely say i have downloaded probably about 500 albums, and i would have paid for only 1 of them (which i actually did go out and buy, because i wanted the official copy, and it was cheap at the time)

i wouldn’t go fuckin buy a lady gaga single because i thought it was catchy and wanted to listen to it a few more times etc…
